message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to show you this amazing product! It's a unique opportunity to own something truly special. I'm willing to sell it to you for $9500.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8500. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
Thank you for your offer, Bob! I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not quite ready to accept $8500. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $9000.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. I'm willing to make a serious commitment to buy the product if we can agree on that price.

Bob, I understand that you're serious about buying the product, and I appreciate your willingness to make a commitment. However, I'm not quite ready to accept $8000. I'm willing to make a slight adjustment and offer it to you for $8200.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $8100. Can we make a deal at that price?
Bob, I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway again. However, I'm not quite ready to accept $8100. I'm willing to make another slight adjustment and offer it to you for $8150.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the maximum price I'm willing to pay. I'm willing to go up to $8100, but I need you to meet me at that price. Can we make a deal at $8100?
Bob, I understand your concerns, but I'm not willing to go all the way down to $8100. I'm willing to make one more adjustment and offer it to you for $8125.
I'm not willing to go any higher than $8100. I'm willing to walk away if we can't agree on a price. Can you meet me at $8100?
